text: Hi All, please, may you have a look at this change-set <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2729/> ?
I need it in to continue the refactoring process of the core/crypto/primitives package and progress on the MSP implementation. Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
looking
looks cool IMO
<@U0ZR63HLK> - merged (but I did have a comment on removing use of viper here in the future)
Thanks All. <@U0PB67X4K> which is your view on viper?

well what I'd like to see in your package specifically is to remove the use of viper entirely and then just construct the config object with appropriate parameters (which the calling program can extract from wherever it wants)
but for now, nothing wrong with what you have given our current way of doing things elsewhere
I agree
my next change-set will remove also that
and introduce the concept of keystore
then I will be ready also to finalise the integration of the BCCSP into the MSP :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0ZR63HLK>, I really liked your interface() in the previous CR, btw.
which one?
that for KeyImport?
Yup, the one I merged last (before this one)
the pattern I was using before to import ecdsa.PublicKey or x509 cert was pretty ugly. Now it is better :slightly_smiling_face:

I think the more people/we use the interface, the more feedback we’d get and the clearer things will get. We are laying the foundations and changes/updates are expected. Nothing is carved in stone. “Yet!” :wink:
I agree
:slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0KM61BCP> sorry, that wasn't meant to pick on you...you just freaked me out that it went in when I wasnt looking :wink:
(it would break certain modes of access, that's why it was abandoned)
but, crisis averted
i guess the related question I have is: are you seeing a hole in the .gitignore setup in some way that caused you to think that in the first place?
<@U0KPFAZNF>  - <@U0KM61BCP> can dish it out so he needs to be able to take it as well  :wink:
Hi All again, another change-set for you: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2733/> . Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2667/5>
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2673/5>
<@U11MANG9G> Thanks for the feedback. Comments addressed :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0KM61BCP> thanks for adding the commit to the JIRA
I forgot
I had to rebase, needs +2: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2459/>
<@U0ZR63HLK>: approved, thanks.
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2733>
great, thanks :slightly_smiling_face: Someone else willing to merge? :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0ZR63HLK> merged… HOWEVER, I was disappointed at the paltry test coverage for a new component - accidental testing isn’t really good enough
please add tests for fileks.go to bring it into the 90% range of coverage
thanks <@U0KM61BCP>, I will add the tests
thank you!

something in orderer (using Solo) is broken recently. its receiving transactions but appearst to be dropping them randomly… by random, I mean the same transaction content does appear to trigger cut/deliver block…. looking at it. Will also post on consensus
^^^ fix for the above in <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2741/> .. will notify consensus slack as well
